website_summaries.verdict: Great for those who want a furniture-like box. Otherwise, an impractical choice.
pros: An attractive alternative to the traditional litter box
cons: Costlier and heavier than a traditional box
Interior material traps odors and is not waterproof

customer_reviews.title: LITTER PAN THAT FITS!
customer_reviews.text: This is a decently priced piece that hides an unsightly cat box. I struggled to find a litter pan to fit inside. The measurements in the item description are odd. I have attached pictures to help fellow shoppers struggling to find a litter pan that fits! I was able to find a high back/sided litter pan at Target for around $9 by "Boots&Barkley". Perfect fit!
customer_reviews.author: mrsstamkos

customer_reviews.title: Good quality!
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice product. I was afraid my scaredy cat would not use it but she tried it within 10 mins.
customer_reviews.author: Verushka

customer_reviews.title: Keeping cats from peeing onto the floor of the pet house.
customer_reviews.text: Some reviewers have mentioned that if your cat pees over the side of the litter box and onto the floor of the "pet house," it gradually breaks down the wood and destroys the structure. This happened to the first one of these I bought. I've bought a replacement, and this time I've been taping three sides of the litter bag up on the inside of the house using masking tape (see photo, the masking tape is blue). Since the cats seem to always pee facing out of the pet house, this prevents the urine from going over the side of the litter box. Thus far, the wooden floor of the structure has remained urine free.
customer_reviews.author: STLgardener

customer_reviews.title: Dachshund approved!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10lb dachshund so she could have her own space. It was pretty easy to put together with solid feeling construction. It looks and feels really nice. It took all of 15 seconds before she hopped into the cabinet and curled up for a nap. She seems to fit inside just fine and she has no fear of the door height (short legged dog problems). We are both very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Emily W

customer_reviews.title: I was very happy with this item when I first got it
customer_reviews.text: I waited a while before I wrote my review. I was very happy with this item when I first got it. It was a little challenging to put together not because it was hard, but because it was awkward in getting pieces in, etc. Now that I have had it for a while I will say that it is falling apart and not as sturdy as I would have hoped it to be. It scratches very easily. at First I was going to purchase another. Now, I am looking to replace this one. I was hoping to like it better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THANK GOD
customer_reviews.text: I adopted 2 kittens & was slowly but surely losing my mind trying to find a location for the litter box. My bathroom is in my bedroom & I was sick of waking up to cat poop smell (they love to take 6am poops). It was unsightly in the living room...until now. This thing is the absolute best thing I can find. It doesn't ruin my aesthetic design & the kittens took to it quickly. Im finally at peace. (PS - Assembly is NOT easy. I had to bring in a handyman to assemble for me).
customer_reviews.author: Lil B

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: It was a little confusing putting it together, but overall it was easy. I absolutely love it! I am not a cat person and I have to take my brothers cat in for 5 months while he's at training. Hiding the litter box in this makes the transition so much easier. Lol. I would recommend this to all cat owners!!! I even went to Home Depot and bought a piece of their in store rug for $6 and nailed it to the top of it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: You should be ashamed of yourself for putting such poor quality product on the market
customer_reviews.text: First I ordered the white and was sent the walnut. Getting over that and not wanting to lug the box back to the post office, I started assembly. Nothing fits right, the small cams kept falling out of the holes before I could put the pieces together. The only thing that went in right was the wooden dowels and the door knob. The door fell off and the top come off every time I try to move it. You should be ashamed of yourself for putting such poor quality product on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but here are some problems you may face
customer_reviews.text: I've had this item for about a year. If you get this itme use a covered litter box inside it unless you are absolutely certain your cat will never miss the box. The material the bottom is made of is not waterproof and will bubble, expand, and hold odor if it gets wet. I also recommend lining it with plastic contact paper before the first use to ensure it lasts longer. Other than that it is a good product that conceals litter boxes well
customer_reviews.author: Mia & Zoe

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to assemble, but it's cute
customer_reviews.text: First, let me tell you, I think I'm pretty handy; I assemble most of my furniture by myself without asking a guy for help. But this one was not that easy to assemble by myself. It helps a lot if you have somebody holding the parts for you. Also, it halps if your kitty is not jumping all over you while working on this! It didn't seem that secure after assembling it the first time, so I had to do it couple of times to make sure it doesn't fall apart. But overal my kitty loves it and started using it right away :)
customer_reviews.author: Beeba

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and Arrived Broken in Multiple Areas
customer_reviews.text: I received this product hoping that it would be the perfect solution to my litter box woes, unfortunately that was not the case. Upon opening the box I discovered that it was broken in multiple places, as if I had been given a used product that had been haphazardly taken apart by the previous owner and returned. Parts where the connecting and securing mechanisms were completely broken off and the magnet that was meant to hold the door shut was broken where you were supposed to connect it to the side of the interior. I somehow managed to put it together JUST enough that it wouldn't collapse on my cat while in use, but overall disappointed in the product.
customer_reviews.author: KatieDinz

customer_reviews.title: So disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: My two cats have used a covered litter box for years, with the only drawback being visibility. I had hopes that this cabinet would solve the problem. Unfortunately, the cabinet is too small for the covered box. I then purchased a small, uncovered litter box that would fit. The problem is the mess. The litter flies everywhere without a cover on the pan. You can't use a deeper pan because it will be too high on the door opening, and the cat won't be able to get in or out. My only option is to use the cabinet for storage and go back to the covered litter pan. Really a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Manke

customer_reviews.title: Holds Only Very Small Litter Boxes
customer_reviews.text: This little house/cupboard is perfect for concealing my cats' litter box. It looks nice, and it's appropriate quality for the price. However, you are very limited on litter boxes you can use with it, as it can only accommodate very small boxes. I had to give up my Tidy Cats Breeze system for this very reason. You also cannot have a box with much of a lip around the edge or it's difficult for the cats to get in and out. Generally, I'm pleased with this product, but I felt I should put those two disclaimers out there.
customer_reviews.author: Ambicat

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely in love with this product as I hated the idea of having to stare at a catbox when I moved into my own apartment. I have this in my bathroom and utilize the top for additional bathroom space and then the middle shelf I utilize for cat toys, cat nail trimmers, etc. My cat absolutely does NOT like to go into this when the door is closed unfortunately, so I have to keep it open. I have paired this with a mesh mat that sticks out about a foot from the opening so he does not track litter around the house. This product is honestly very beautiful and easily can become "furniture".
customer_reviews.author: Sssarah

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Like another reviewer said we put the IRIS open-top litter box inside it. We got navy color littler box which is 15" W x 18 7/8" L x 11 11/16" and it fits great with some wiggle room to spare on sides and room on top too. One of my cats can be a little particular about box placement and I was worried he wouldn't like to go inside but he took to it right away. My kitten, who cares little about little, also loves it. No problems at all with either using it, in fact, they seem to like it. Assembly was simple, took about 15 min. Similar to IKEA set up and quality.
customer_reviews.author: BreeTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: The smallest/lowest boxes still block some of the entrance
customer_reviews.text: For as many pieces as there were, it was surprisingly easy to put together. The only tool you need is a screwdriver. I did have to buy a smaller litter box. The opening in the front door is bizarrely low. Any regular litter box inside basically blocks the entrance, and the smallest/lowest boxes still block some of the entrance. If you were able to cut the box any lower it simply wouldn’t hold any litter. It makes no sense and it doesn’t look very nice. But the cat can get in and out now so it works. If it weren’t for that glaring issue I would have given it 5 stars. The rest of it looks nicer than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Great Surface Space + Litter Box Solution
customer_reviews.text: Love the addition of a little shelf to place items. Easy to open and clean. Do not use the towel rack so cannot comment on it. Pros: -Great assembly instructions -Good, quality pieces (yes, the back is MDF but that's not a dealbreaker for me) -Some screw covers and such if you want this piece to look more polished and complete -Nice wide, opening for even my lazy big cats to get through Cons: -Awkward sizing for litter boxes
customer_reviews.author: Emily Igawa

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and perfect for cats
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect in size, color, and purpose. We have a dog so we always keep our cats food on top of something higher. I needed a corner table for our bathroom and found this perfect cat house. Our cats perfectly jump up to eat their food (and our dog cannot reach) and it is cozy for them to sleep in or hide. It is sturdy and looks high quality. It took me about 45 minutes to assemble it myself.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL A. DELLARIPA

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy, poor quality, pre stripped screws on the door brackets so the door won't stay straight. Hardware is terrible. All the twist "nuts" that assemble the stand are not tight at all and they don't lock into position. So it makes a very wonky wobbly kitty room. There's no way to justify the price tag on this item other than it's a specialty thing... I'm very disappointed. Now I have to take it back down and return it. It was also damaged inside a perfect box. So they damaged it themselves while packing. Stay away from this. If it was 20 bucks it would make more sense.
customer_reviews.author: brian ellsion

customer_reviews.title: Good in theory
customer_reviews.text: So I really wanted to like this thing. Since I have to keep one of my cats in my bedroom I was looking for something to kind of camouflage the litter box. Issue number one: finding a litter pan that fits well within this cabinet. Issue number two: once you do find one that fits (sort of) the cat is still able to miss the box and/or fling litter around the perimeter of the actual interior litter pan. It ultimately just creates a mess. Now I'm stuck with a fully assembled contraption that was fairly expensive and is now useless to me. :( Super bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie

customer_reviews.title: Not for scatter cats
customer_reviews.text: This product is fine, doesn’t seem to soak in smells or anything. It also looks pretty nice. However, it doesn’t keep our scattter-cat from getting litter everywhere. The door and the floor have gaps that litter escape from, leading back to the same problem I saught to eliminate with this charming, simple box. This would be a great product if your cat doesn’t throw litter into the air like they just don’t care. If you’re looking for style (hiding a litterbox) instead of function (scatter control), this would be a good product for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love these litter boxes you can turn it so no sees the opening but the kitty when he needs it and is a nice looking table. Door opens to get the box in and out easily. We also have one in the bed room that the kitty uses as a bed and the kids use as a night stand. If you use it in the bathroom has a bar on the side you can put magazine or towel on. We put a s hook on it and hang the litter scoop on the side.
customer_reviews.author: Cammy McAdams

customer_reviews.title: This was actually pretty awesome, especially for the cost we paid XD ...
customer_reviews.text: This was actually pretty awesome, especially for the cost we paid XD Our cat started using it right away, and we were able to put her old bin inside... Now I have a place to put towels on top, and other thingies in the between levels, like tp and baby wipes for my cat's face :D I also put a basket on top that holds all of my makeup stuff. We have a tiny bathroom, so this piece of furniture has changed our life!! lolol... Chicago apartment struggles, ok!? Don't judge me for getting too excited :D Unless you live in a big city, you wouldn't understand xD -Beatriz Santana
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Miller

customer_reviews.title: Door connection breaks
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two, thinking the first time the door area broke off that it was a fluke. I was wrong. The second purchase had the same issue. It was decently priced (50 at the time) but now it's over 100, def not worth it for the disposable quality.
customer_reviews.author: josipa

customer_reviews.title: Fell Apart
customer_reviews.text: I loved this and got many compliments on it but just a little over a month after use the door fell off. The bottom front of the cabinet sisterly was damaged and chunk of it just literally fell off. The door no longer can be attached because the bottom peg that sits in the depression has no place to sit because of the chunk that fell off. We tried gluing it but that didn't work. This cabinet is now useless to me so I'll be throwing it away. If it had broken during the 30 days I would have returned it but since it's been about 45 days I don't know of any options to fix this.
customer_reviews.author: Chalee

customer_reviews.title: This thing has been great. It really helps mask the smell
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been great. It really helps mask the smell, but with that being said, it is made of particle board. So if your cat pees even a little outside of the box(which if it’s a bigger cat they will) even if your cat never does this...it seeps into the wood and you cannot get the smell out. If the bottom was made out of plastic or you put something down to protect it, it truly is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Coral

customer_reviews.title: Small, but does the job well!
customer_reviews.text: Goes together relatively easy and looks great. The only issue, the inside depth is too small for my litterbox. I use the Tidy Cat Breeze litter system and won't go back to scooping pee clumps ever again. So the fix, I left off the solid back panel off which is nothing more than glorified cardboard. With the door on and close, you can't even tell that the rear is open. Still fits nicely against the wall as I only need a couple of inches. All in all, we're ordering a second until for the other litterbox because it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent J. Pisano

customer_reviews.title: Cat Loved it Right Away!
customer_reviews.text: This product was delivered as anticipated. It was fairly easy to put together and came with extra hardware just in case. I thought I had a large litter box, so I was worried about the box fitting inside the stand, but it's perfect! My cat loved it right away and loves sitting on top (equal to the window sill, so he can do a lot of bird watching). Towel rack can go on either side. Door stays shut, but it isn't hard to open.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Kitties love it
customer_reviews.text: Kitties love this and it looks so much nicer than an open litter box in the kitchen/dining nook. Quick to assemble. We sprayed a sealer/rubber liner type spray all over the inside of the cabinet. I also tape pee pads on three walls and place one on the floor. We have one notorious sprayer and I wasn't gonna risk it. No leaks, easy to clean, and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Harper

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer errors and scratches to finish
customer_reviews.text: This product came scratched (the top piece, which is really noticeable) and on assembly the hinges on the door didn't align properly nor does it fit properly, thankfully I have a handy husband and he was able to make it work by removing the hinges and adjusting them as well as trimming the door about 1 cm. If you are prepared to do this the door may not fit. I would send it back but its already put together and its going in a laundry room, so no one is really going to see it.
customer_reviews.author: Dodd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Product was as described. Took about 20 min to assemble. I can see as per other reviews that constant moisture will damage the particle board. So I have covered the base with clear contact. Two of my 3 cats went in there immediately to check it out. The third refuses but I’m sure he will be fine. It’s lightweight enough for me to move around. I’m happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Line with plastic
customer_reviews.text: I put a litter box with a lid inside of here. Seems like overkill but it still looks nicer, and my cat likes to hang her butt off the edge when there isn’t a lid which leads to sometimes missing. If anything gets outside the litter box, it will soak into the wood and not be good. If you have an open litter pan inside I highly recommend lining with plastic (target has rolls of clear plastic drawer liner for like $7) to keep the cheap wood from getting ruined and make it easier to clean. Otherwise looks nice!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Jones

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, but way too small for bigger cats.
customer_reviews.text: This is decent, and serves the purpose of hiding a litter box. I just wish it were taller and slightly bigger to hold most litter pans. It was very easy to put together though. *UPDATE* Due to the small size of this piece, my chubby kitty cannot comfortably due his business if the litter box is inside. So now I use it to store bags of litter and cleaning supplies. For small cats this might be ok, but for large kitties I highly recommend finding something else.
customer_reviews.author: rosiethervtr

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed with this item. It's not sturdy at all. I followed the directions step by step and it took an hour. I got it in white and it easily scratches. I attached the towel bar to one side and decided I needed it on the other and it left marks around the holes...which the wood inserts don't cover up. As long as we keep in the room it's in and don't move it, it should hold up ok because we have a small cat but if we move, it won't survive being handled. It looks nice, and it does hide the liter, but I'm overal disatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Evans

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Cost
customer_reviews.text: The best idea I can compare this to is a Walmart product, a glorified-cardboard box. The quality is no where near worth the cost and as the pictures show, it arrived with several dings and dents. It’s too short to even consider using the towel rack and the door sits too low for the box to look correct inside. I’m only giving it 2 stars for the reason that it is at least functional and hides my cat box from the side. There’s no way this could ever be worth the almost $100 the company has been asking for it; I’m kind of peeved I even paid $45; it’s definitely not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: The Merry Pet Washroom was super easy to assemble. It is very sturdy. I was a little concerned that a litter box would fit in the bottom and still leave room for the cat to get in but there was plenty of room. My cat had one accident right outside the washroom. I would suggest placing the washroom in the same spot that the litter box has been in or place the litter box in plain view for a few days before you hide it in the washroom. My cat quickly adapted and seems to like it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Miller

customer_reviews.title: Well built, but a bit hard to find the right size litter box
customer_reviews.text: You really have very few options of litter boxes that will fit inside this thing. I bought two for our laundry room since the width and length were a perfect fit to sit next to our dryer. One of our litter boxes just happened to fit absolutely perfectly. Finding a clone of that litter box proved to be a bit of a challenge, but eventually found one after taking measurements to make sure it would fit.
customer_reviews.author: Zsoldier

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: A great way to hide an ugly cat box! Easy to build, clear instructions. While building I added a lining normally used for kitchen drawers and laid an open garbage bag around the disposable litter box on the bottom, works perfect. I used to constantly be sweeping litter off the floor, this is no longer a problem. I have also not been able to smell the cat box at all. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Hil 💘

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, poor building materials, even worse smell!
customer_reviews.text: This is cheap particle board that they expect to be held together with wooden dowels. Whats worse is that if you try to use real screws without pre-drilling you end up expanding the particle board making this worthless. The design isn't bad but the materials are horrid. Speaking of horrid what do you get when you combine particle board with cat pee? That's right, something thats next to impossible to clean! Do yourself a favor and pass on this, consider building one yourself, or get another product all together. Had I read a review similar to this I would not have bought it!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: may end up in garbage, this was not what I bought it for ...
customer_reviews.text: Put it together, if you pick it up and move it, things start falling apart no matter how much you tighten it (yes, we followed the instructions). Threw a pillow in so my cats can use it as a house, not even feeling confident about that, may end up in garbage, this was not what I bought it for but it cannot be used the way I intended as too cheap and flimsy. Basically I think it is total junk, would give it a zero if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi D.

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice cabinet.
customer_reviews.text: It could be a little bit bigger to hold a larger litter box. DO NOT order any of the litter boxes that it shows at the bottom of the page as suggested items to purchase with it. I am still trying to find a box that measures under 18Lx16W to fit inside. I found some temporary litter boxes that fit but they have to throw out and replaced as they are recycled paper products. They work very well, just not Deep enough.
customer_reviews.author: Becci

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but a tad overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to hopefully keep the family dogs out of the cat's litterbox. The entrance is too small for the dogs to reach their head's in, so it wins in that sense. My cat is almost a year and she can easily move in and out. If she gets too much bigger, we will have to make our own door as she wont fit the entrance. Her litterbox fit without issue and with room to spare on the sides. My only complaint is the price. I dont feel like this piece was worth $65. It feels like a piece of Ikea furniture. It doesnt feel cheap, but a tad overpriced for what was paid.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Wittman

customer_reviews.title: I love this cat washroom
customer_reviews.text: I'll admit I was skeptical of this at first. A piece of furniture to put a litter box in, I thought it was a terrible idea. After getting it and using it, I love it. My cat loves having a private space to go in. I love how clean it has made him. He used to just flick litter everywhere around the box, and I'd have litter all over. Now it is all confined to a small easy to clean space. I think all cat owners need one. If for nothing else to give your furry friends some privacy while they go.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Not for Longer (larger) Cats...
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to pretty-up the area where the cat box is kept. This cabinet is certainly more attractive than the typical black or tan plastic cat boxes, and was relatively simple to put together. Where it failed was the length. Specifically, if you have a larger cat this cabinet simply isn’t long enough (I know some reviews say it’s fine for larger breeds, but it didn’t work for us). As a result, my large cat would end up peeing over the lip of the cabinet opening. She’s about 23” long (not counting her tail). Our other, smaller cat, had no issues. It’s too bad... lovely looking cabinet!
customer_reviews.author: Heather M.

customer_reviews.title: Great discreet litter box solution
customer_reviews.text: Elegant solution for keeping the litter boxes hidden. I keep plants on top so it doesn't feel like the cat's corner. I keep mine in the kitchen and can't smell the litter, and it keeps all the dust inside. Doors open so you can easily access the boxes for cleaning. Inside can be wiped down too. I will no longer hide litter boxes in closets! This makes it easy to clean the boxes on a regular basis without stinking up a room.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie VB

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be bigger for some reason, but it turned out to be the perfect size for our spare bathroom. My only issue with this was putting it together. I'm not a huge fan of cams and I didn't realize there were two different sizes until after I put it together, which is my bad, but in the end this cat box concealer is doing its intended job. My other issue is the price; honestly, for the size, it could be a little cheaper. I will end up making another purchase in the future, since I will need another one for the master bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Mandu

customer_reviews.title: The finish on the bottom under the litter pan has worn off and holds the smell.
customer_reviews.text: Initially this seemed like a good product but as time passed I realized it was not holding up well. some of the inserts have fallen off. It is a little rickety when I move it to clean under it. The litter will fall out of it around the bottom somehow and the finish on the bottom has worn off and the board is holding the smell. Cats will not use it anymore I suppose because of the the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Mary B

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice and does the job, not very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: This litter box cabinet looks nice and functions as advertised. I am happy with the purchase, but will not buy again when (not if) this one falls apart. The panels are individually nice and seem high quality for the price point, but the way it’s constructed and the hardware used leaves it very flimsy and wobbly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Pappas

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: We used this litterbox for about 10 months, half of which was spent trying to keep it from falling apart. Also, our cats are high pee-ers and so the wood was getting urine on it, and even with constant cleaning, the wood became warped and smelled awful.
customer_reviews.author: Adaylia

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to receive this product but was very disappointed with the quality. I guess you get what you get for the price. The wood was warped and that made it impossible to put together correctly. The entire thing wobbles when you open the door because of the warped wood. It also came scuffed on the top which is the part that you can see so that sucks. Overall was not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Good unit
customer_reviews.text: takes some time to assemble. I recieved mine with a wrong part. Customer service did send a new part but hasseled me about it. After telling them I would just return it they sent the new part. They need to have better quality control but the unit itself, once assembled is an attractive and quality unit.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Lovely cabinet but does NOT fit a Tidy Cats Litter System
customer_reviews.text: This is a lovely cabinet for the litter. The instructions were very clear and it was super simple to put together. I'm happy with the purchase. That being said, this cabinet does NOT fit a Tidy Cats Litter System box. We got creative and ended up using a jigsaw to cut each end of the litter box off so that it would fit. I then used a strip of duck tape to hide some holes in the back. It's not perfect, but it works and the cats were using it within seconds of finishing.
customer_reviews.author: KitCat

customer_reviews.title: Missing hardware...
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these. First one went together well and looks pretty decent and feels stable. Unpacked the second box only to find that all the hardware and the hand towel bar are missing. So frustrating! Now I have to try to repack all the pieces in the box, minus most of the packing material, because the foam pretty much breaks to pieces in the unpacking process and take it to the UPS place across town to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn D.M. Heys

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Poops In His Own Little House + Hidden Litter Tray = GOOD.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great in the corner of my bathroom and the shelf is perfect for a mini brush and dustpan set. I put some seashells on the top and a fake orchid. Bam. Prettiest poop box ever. Cat seems happy to use it and door makes it easy to open up and clean. Easy to put together, good quality. Thoughtful design includes a small hook for the little scooper that is included. I'm really happy with this purchase. I never have to look at the litter box that's in this cabinet. (Just the 2nd litter box that I had to buy because my cat is a choosy litter jerk. But that's another story for another review.)
customer_reviews.author: San Diego Native

customer_reviews.title: A Kitty Loo For Cats Who Poo
customer_reviews.text: Great way to cover up those ugly litter boxes and create a private space for kitty. Takes a while to assemble but instructions are pretty useful compared to other DIY furniture I have used. While the photo shows a lovely vase of flowers, pretty towels etc.. it is safe to say your cat will probably want to take it over completely and sleep on the top, so I wouldn't put breakable stuff up there. The white "country" look goes well in your bathroom, hallway, or kids room. A lot sturdier and more well-made than expected, especially given the price. Only question is: will your fussy cat actually USE it?
customer_reviews.author: Tammy de Leeuw

customer_reviews.title: I didn't take into consideration the size of the access ...
customer_reviews.text: I didn't take into consideration the size of the access hole on the door & unfortunately, is it large enough for my Chocolate Lab to get his head in there & have a little kitty-roca snack.........YUCK! Does not hold a full-size litter box, will need one that is a little smaller. Works well to keep the litter contained when they're digging & push litter over the side of the box, Works well to contain the smell too -- although I do have a Bath & Body Works Wallflower hanging right next to the litter box to help with smells.
customer_reviews.author: Athompson

customer_reviews.title: Quality is iffy but price is right!
customer_reviews.text: I assembled the construction under an hour and it was all very simple, but it's a bit rickety. Cheap materials that wobble a little bit when fully assembled. I gotta say though, for the price, it's well worth the purchase. It looks great and it easy to clean. Definitely sturdy enough to withstand some weight of a big lamp, picture frames, and my cat.
customer_reviews.author: Chan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & Effective
customer_reviews.text: I was initially intimidated by all the parts to be assembled but once I realized they were all lettered and numbered it was really easy to put it together by merely looking at the pictures. The large Arm & Hammer litter box with the high side lid fits inside perfectly so I won't have any concerns about my cat spraying urine on the interior walls of the cabinet. My cat took to it right away and jumped in before I could even put the litter box inside.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome table and really cute
customer_reviews.text: Awesome table and really cute. Only problem (which can be bad) is when cat pee sprays out of the box and the urine is absorbed in wood over time. I had to cut my bottom off and replace is with another piece of wood. I also put a water proof covering over all inside surfaces which was much easier to wipe down. However, the urine smell was forever stuck in the wood. Had to get a new one a couple months after but waterproofed the inside immediately. Seemed to helps bit so far. I wish they made one that was already water-proof and leakproof so the urine wouldn't soak in the wood
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS THING. We have the kitty litter in the laundry room and it makes it look so much nicer now that it’s not just a stinky kitty litter sitting there, I also put his food on top of it so now that it’s off the floor there’s more room! I’m also hoping having to jump up and down for his food gives him a little exercise ;) just a fair warning it is on par with cheap Walmart furniture so it’s not the best material, but it works for our fat cat and looks nice!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Couple of disclaimers. (Updated review...not good)
customer_reviews.text: It makes my condo look so much better w/o a litter box showing! Plus I put their food bowl on top so that’s another plus. However, It’s a little flimsy (maybe due to the kind of screws?). I got a regular sized litter box & it’s snug in the cubby. The door does close though. All in all, I’m happy with the purchase. Update: the door fell off after a couple of weeks. I was able to wood glue it back on but it just broke off again. I ended up throwing it away. Major let down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and minimizes litter on the floor
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! It keeps a good portion of the litter off the floor and it looks fabulous. I've used it for a couple weeks now and I have no complaints. We were able to train our small dog to use it without any trouble, since it was already using a litter box. She was skiddish at first, but with a few minutes of training her to get in the box and come back out with lots of praise and treats, she quickly overcame her fear of getting inside. Now she has no trouble using it and it looks so nice in the house. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: dskelly77

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material vs cat pee, guess who the winner is?
customer_reviews.text: This product is inherently flawed. It just takes one time for your male cat to miss the litter box and the cat pee will soak into the rather poorly made covering for the pressed wood. This will result in a pee smell that cannot be cleaned out. I see how some customers lined the box with trash bags, however, this seems to be an attempt to make up for a rather poor design. We have tried every "urine removing" spray and wash to no avail. If you have female cats, this box may work great for you.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte A Morla

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, looks nice
customer_reviews.text: This only lasted 11 months of normal wear and tear of a single cat household before the back and bottom started to crack. The entire thing is made out of press board, so any handling risks ripping the screws right through the wood. Once it became unstable, the door fell right off. Also, be sure that you measure the height of your litter box, or else you risk your cat kicking litter right out of the opening onto the floor. I will say that I got many compliments on how it looked and I was happy with it for about 6 months, but this cannot be considered a long term solution unless you treat it with extreme care while cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is much better than I thought
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent quality alternative for hiding the cat litter. It has a surface that is a bit shiny and easily cleaned. It hides the litter and provides a nice spot on top for the cat's food - great if you have a dog that like to eat cat food. I only wish there as a paw ID to identify the cat vs. dog so the dog doesn't have access to the kitty treats.
customer_reviews.author: cd777

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these for our three cats. (We left our other two boxes non-enclosed, because that is what our cats prefer.) These look and conceal very well, and our cats have no problem using these, one of which weighs 20lbs. We used high back litter pans, but just an added protection to keep the inside of the boxes from getting gross, we sprayed the inside with Rust-Oleum Never Wet Multi-Purpose Kit.Construction was simple, husband barely complained and he always complains.
customer_reviews.author: Solitaire

customer_reviews.title: "Like new"
customer_reviews.text: Item came scratched, broken and in horrible shape. The description said like new. It was not like new. Did not have time to return it and get another one. Am very disappointed. Called to complain and got 10 dollars back, but realized after the fact there was more damage than expected. A metal piece was also missing. Should have received a full refund and been able to keep the item at this point. Had to put in 2+ hours of work to glue and piece it together, had to replace magnet, touch it up with paint. Sucks
customer_reviews.author: kiekie95177

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Terrible to put together. I'm pretty sure part 2a was defective. I've put together bookshelves I've ordered from Amazon with similar parts to 2a. Nothing attached using 2a (a twist bolt that would hold a screw head) held together. After about 8 times, I finally gave up and nailed it together.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice but smaller than expected inside
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble and it definitely looks much nicer that just a covered litter box. Unfortunately, our litter pan didn’t fit, and I suspect most larger pans won’t. I did find a smaller, basic litter pan that fits, but it doesn’t have the raised back so I fear my male cat is going to pee on the back wall instead of in the pan. I’ll update my review if that ends up being a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ronda Duluoz

customer_reviews.title: Seriously great buy. Hides the litter box perfectly
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this more than 5 stars I would. Super easy to put together. No missing parts. This is so versatile. I personally bought it to hide the ugly ness of the cat box. You can use it as a dog bed, cat bed, shoot even my 4 year old thought it was his toy house before I sadly disappointed him with telling him what was going in it. Worth every penny of the purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: Bridgett Rundall

customer_reviews.title: I like the overall design
customer_reviews.text: I like the overall design. I'm able to have my kitty litter next to my washer and dryer without it standing out. I'm also able to put things (e.g. laundry basket) on top of it which I was not able to before. I don't like the fact that the cat walks straight out of the kitty litter onto the floor, but products that address this were too large for the space. Litter that falls out of the litter box can slide out under the door. It would be better if there was a lip to prevent that. Overall, I like the product and would buy it again.

customer_reviews.title: Very cute
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together, looks great in my apartment too! I took the advice from other reviews and bought a plastic box and cut out a whole.. worked great! My only issue is that one of my cats wouldn't turn around when he went in and would pee outside or right at the door which sadly made the whole thing fall apart a month after I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Parousya :)

customer_reviews.title: Form over Function
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, but if any moisture gets onto the "wood" for even a short period of time, the particle board begins to expand and it starts to look pretty bad very quickly. I used a rustoleum water proof spray paint to seal the inside. I also caulked all the joints and the screw points to ensure no moisture would get inside. I ALSO put in a high sided litter box inside. The sides are 10 inches high plastic. The moisture still gets through, and at the end of the day despite my best efforts, this house still deteriorated in a very short period of time.
customer_reviews.author: William Houston

customer_reviews.title: Pretty, but not sturdy enough to call furniture.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the product as housing for my cat's litter box. It arrived today. Took 30-45 minutes to put together. (It is possible to assemble with 1 person). The directions are not the easiest to understand if you're not assembly savvy (as it's just pictures, and they are not very detailed). Once assembled, I thought it was very sturdy.....until I placed it upright. It's very rickety. It looks great, but not very solid. The cat is unimpressed ( shocking). If you're looking for a solid piece of furniture.....this is not it. Just looking for a pretty place to put something not so pleasant.....perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Wadella Who?

customer_reviews.title: This is actually pretty well designed and practical
customer_reviews.text: This is actually pretty well designed and practical. It replaced a much more substantial, high quality piece I'd had for years, but that one had a pull-out (draw-like) bottom piece which quickly became non-functional because litter irreparably jammed the mechanism. This one is really easy to use. I'm glad somebody had suggested lining it with Contact paper to keep urine from permeating and leaving an odor. I did that and highly recommend it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Michele M L

customer_reviews.title: Looks are deceiving
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing this box is too small for cat litter box. I was excited to get a fancy furniture litter box for my cats, but this is the worst the cats are urinating outside the pan because the box is too small. Now I have to toss this out, can't use it for anything thing else, now it smells. Waste of money. 1 star for appearance. I feel like my money in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: missfitness

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional form AND function
customer_reviews.text: I keep my kitty's box in my bedroom, and I really like that this little stand blends in so well with the rest of my furniture. It's spacious enough to fit most litterboxes, and the wood surface makes it easy to keep clean. The table itself is also very sturdy can comfortably hold a surprising amount of weight.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking litterbox cabinet.
customer_reviews.text: Hides a litterbox perfectly, took a while to assemble, but the process was straightforward and the instructions were clear. I'd prefer to have a door that could be hinged on either side, so one star off for me. (You can install the railing on either side). Once assembled the surface is easy to wipe down (I just use a damp cloth). The cats were a little cautious at first, but have taken to it with no issues. I put it in my bathroom and the finish goes with the existing cabinets (not exactly, but close enough) so does not look out of place. The color is the same as the picture. I use this litterbox
customer_reviews.author: Peter Mcmillan

customer_reviews.title: Sh*tt*n pretty
customer_reviews.text: It’s a beautiful piece for those limited on space needing a litter box solution that isn’t an eye sore. The surface is a great place to put your choice of deodorizing decor to mask the smells of potty breaks. Only complaint is the pieces of hardware aren’t perfect fits in all respective locations, but it’s workable. I’m a huge girly girl that is much more experienced in things like hair and makeup, and I built it by the time my husband was done with a shower .
customer_reviews.author: DollyMcclain

customer_reviews.title: Not as desired
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy the nightstand because a friend of mine had and recommended it pretty highly but I am not as pleased. It’s a pretty cheap nightstand, quality wise, and it’s not very sturdy. The edges of the wood were really scuffed up when I took it out of the box and after constructing the entire thing it’s wobbly, regardless of how tight the screws are. Also it’s not as big as I anticipated, I’ll be measuring it again to compare but it’s safe to say I’m pretty disappointed in the product.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Rae

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Lasted about 3 months. Great concept but cheap materials. Particle board can not stand up to the daily use. Door broke off, among other external damaged areas. I use a covered litter box so no kitty mess has been in contact with the wood. Looking for other product at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Gerik

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased / Quick & Easy Assembly
customer_reviews.text: The is a u useful side table with room for a lamp on top and the remotes beneath. The door was left off and a cat bed put in the bottom. All parts were present and all panels marked to easily cross reference the visual assembly directions. It's sturdy and went together in half an hour using a small phillips head and a medium screw driver.
customer_reviews.author: CTC

customer_reviews.title: Forget IKEA this is worse and needs several adjustments
customer_reviews.text: If you have a cat around 12 lbs a regular container won't fit. Forget IKEA this is worse and needs several adjustments. I only bought it again. Evause of the style but the time and frustration make me wonder whether if it's worth it. You will need a power drill because there is no hole for the bottom door hinge. It's too much of a hassle to return and the old one is 4 years old. So if you can stand the nightmare and enjoy the price go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Monica A.

customer_reviews.title: IKEA quality, but much much better than an exposed litter box.
customer_reviews.text: I was really worried that my cats wouldn't use this with a litterbox inside it -- especially since one of my cats is fairly...rotund. The quality isn't stellar, but it is sturdy and doesn't look overly cheap (think IKEA quality). I bought the white so that I could paint it a color to match the other decor in my apartment. For anyone that is using this as a cat litter box hider rather than a small dog bed hider, I would suggest still placing some sort of mat outside to attract and collect litter. I found a litter box that fits, but there isn't enough clearance to *also* catch all the litter as the cats exit.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: We moved to a new home with no space besides our mater bedroom for the litter box. So this is doubling as a nightstand/litter hideaway right next to my bed. It’s perfect. I use a litter deodorizer and I’ve had no problems with smell. It fits nicely with my room decor.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Mehl

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great alternative to just having an unsightly litter box out in the open. Living in a house that does not have a good, accessible area to put the litter box, this was a lifesaver. My friends did not even realize it was a litter box cover until they saw the door. It does get a little smelly but a basic wipe down with bleach spray and it is back to being undetectable. I was able to fit my cat's littler box, with the cover and I have not had any issues with "mess" outside the box.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Keating

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Very plased with this product. Pros: Looks elegant, it's very study. Easy to assemble. Does it's purpose Cons: My cat still drops sand oustide of the hole. It might come with more screws than what you need so it can be confusing, some bags might have the wrong number or letter from the instructions but easy to figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: It's great as long as your cat doesn't pee outside whichever ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my third one of this exact same model in the past nine years. It's great as long as your cat doesn't pee outside whichever actual litter box you put inside of it - if that happens, the wood will warp and permanently smell. So, I do like it, but from my personal experience, definitely not ideal for any cats with kidney/bladder problems.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Not As Great As I Had Expected :(
customer_reviews.text: One good thing I will say is that the condo looks really nice and the structure is not bad, but after about 4 months of usage the wood started to get 'stinky' from my kitty's urine. My cat is a boy, so I think he probably didn't pee inside the parameters of the litter box that I put inside, so the bottom part of the wood (under the litter box) was damp. Also, the condo wood seemed to hold the poop scent too, even after I've cleaned out the litter box. I disinfected the inside and now we're just using it as a Condo for kitty to sleep or play inside.
customer_reviews.author: JanAnn

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing...
customer_reviews.text: This cat side table litter box looks nice, but the quality control is horrible. Holes for the cams on the top didn't even come close to lining up. And there were several unsightly scratches from shipping damage.
customer_reviews.author: Fokker's Feint

customer_reviews.title: Adorable
customer_reviews.text: I loved this thing and used it for 5 years. I could only use certain litter pans from target because of the unique size. I got rid of it because wet litter accumulated in the back and destroyed the wood. The pans I bought were short (again all that fits) and over time got really nasty. I would buy another if my new pan would fit in it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Panda

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Every Cat Parent! 😺
customer_reviews.text: Not too complicated to assemble, majority of cat litter boxes fit inside.(fat cats too!) My 2 cats were hesitant for a few hours, but i left the door open all day & night until they understood it was the new " litter station" and now it's officially their own rest stop now too. The top shelf now holds foods & water dish and on the bottom shelf I keep litter box liners. I've even installed a small cup hook on the inside wall to hang up the litter scoop. I'm happy, and they're happy - So glad I got this! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Some parts slightly cracked, and the directions aren’t accurate. A lot flimsier than it looks, but all in all, it does get the job done. I wish the top shelf wasn’t so weak feeling as we were planning to put the cat’s food up there but I don’t think it would hold. Should have been cheaper for the quality, but like I said, it gets the job done! Perfect size, and the cats love it already.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Great way to cover up the liter box
customer_reviews.text: Great way to cover up the liter box. Contains a lot of the mess when your cat kicks the liter around. Great storage. I put her food and fountain on the top and snacks in the middle. During assembly, the back board did not fit properly and I had to saw it down, which was frustrating, but everything else came together nicely.
customer_reviews.author: priscilla

customer_reviews.title: Assembly required not worth the effort
customer_reviews.text: After three hours attempting to assemble this, uh, item. I threw it away. The cam slots didn't really fit a PH2 driver. You end up with a dowel and two studs holding together each side and, as you work on it, they fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Careaga

customer_reviews.title: Works, but a bit of a shoddy job on the screw holes.
customer_reviews.text: Works well once put together, but the holes where the parts go in are occassionally very poorly done. From what I can tell there is a manufacturing problem where something the hole will have glue or paint stuck inside the holes. This means you'll have to carefully drill out the hole so the screws can fit. I would call it a mishap if it was just 1 or 2 holes, but I had problems on 4 of the holes and had to pull out my power drill to fix the problem. Other than that it serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! It matches our bathroom furniture perfectly, and is so much better than having a standard, ugly, litterbox. My only complaint is that the manufacturer should have researched common litterbox sizes, and sized it accordingly. It cannot accept the larger litterboxes, so you have to use an undersized one. This creates the problem of mess getting kicked out of the litterbox, into the surrounding enclosure. It can be a pain to clean up. Also, it you have multiple cats, it precludes the use of large/extra large litterboxes; meaning you'll have to scoop and change little much more often.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Good looking, while it lasted (only 2 years)
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years I find myself looking for another solution -- one that is easier to clean (it is really a challenge) and made of material that doesn't buckle and fall apart when it gets wet (I think this is manufactured board, it looks like cardboard when the top layer comes off). The things that did work well (for 2 years, before it fell apart) were the size, the look, and it really did keep the smell down. But for the price, I did expect it to last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh A.

customer_reviews.title: No instructions but works well
customer_reviews.text: This works great for our new kitten! We didn't have any problem fitting a standard cat sized (not kitten sized) litter box in here so I'm not sure why others are having so much trouble. Our only issue is that it didn't come with any instructions! It was pretty difficult and frustrating for us to put together just going off of the picture. Aside from that, the espresso color is actually a very very dark cherry wood so be aware of that. I read the comments and was looking for a dark cherry so it worked perfectly for us, but don't be fooled by the picture for espresso, it's neither matte nor is it brown.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: I genuinely LOVE this kitty bathroom
customer_reviews.text: I genuinely LOVE this kitty bathroom. It is definitely a white color. Assembly was very easy with very clear instructions. I have had it for a few months now and it hasn't budged. My cat was not hesitant to use it at all- but each cat is different. I read a few reviews about kitty pee splash ruining the inside of the bathroom so I used to line it with plastic liners- this soon became a huge pain because cat litter would get underneath the liner and cleaning was difficult. I removed the liners recently and haven't noticed sprays. It is rather small on the inside, so you can't purchase a huge cat litter box to go in it.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

product_meta.title: Cat Washroom Night Stand
product_meta.description: Color:Glossy white| Size:20" L x 18" W x 25" HWhite Cat washroom: No more mess from cat litter boxes. The Cat Washroom serves as an attractive cover to hide away the litter box and confine all litter messes inside, while providing useful shelf space and stainless-steel towel bar for many organizing options. Door opens wide for easy to clean. Fits a large litter pan up to 18.5”W x 16”D. Litter Box not included. Night Stand Pet House: No more unmade and mismatched beds of your pet in your house. This multifunctional unit can also be used as a coffee table or night stand while providing a discrete resting/sleeping area for both dogs and cats, which satisfies your pet’s instinctive need to feel safe and happy., age range: All Life Stages, Included Components: all components of the cat washroom, Material: MDF; stainless steel.
feature_bullets: Attractive, multi-functional pet furniture can set next to your bed or in living area. Hides all litter messes, keeps your kitty litter box hidden
Classic, clean fiberboard cabinet features wainscoting paneling and stainless-steel hardware
Cat litter box - Great for cats or even small dogs
Easy to assemble with included hardware & instructions. Fits cat pans up to 18.5″ wide x 16.0″ deep. Litter box sold separately
Elegant and functional litter box furniture, minimizes odor and prevents litter from spilling out

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
